### Support Request Process

```{mermaid}
%%| fig-cap: "Support Request Workflow"
flowchart TB
    Issue["Issue Identified"]
    Issue --> Self["Self-Service Check"]
    Self --> |Resolved| Done["Issue Resolved"]
    Self --> |Not Resolved| Contact["Contact Helpdesk"]

    Contact --> Email["Email Request"]
    Contact --> Phone["Phone Call"]

    Email --> Ticket["Ticket Created"]
    Phone --> Ticket

    Ticket --> Triage["Issue Triage"]
    Triage --> Resolution["Issue Resolution"]
    Resolution --> Done
```

### What to Include in Support Requests

| Information | Description | Example |
|-------------|-------------|---------|
| **Subject** | Clear, specific title | "VM not starting - chair-web-01" |
| **Description** | Detailed issue description | What happened, when, what you tried |
| **System** | Affected system/service | Server name, service name |
| **Error Messages** | Exact error text | Copy/paste or screenshot |
| **Steps to Reproduce** | How to recreate the issue | Step-by-step instructions |
| **Impact** | Who/what is affected | "10 researchers cannot access files" |
| **Contact** | Your contact information | Phone for urgent follow-up |

### Priority Guidelines

| Priority | Criteria | Response |
|----------|----------|----------|
| **Critical** | Service completely down, affecting many users | Same day |
| **High** | Major functionality impacted | Next business day |
| **Medium** | Partial functionality, workaround available | Within week |
| **Low** | Minor issue, enhancement request | Scheduled |

## Consulting Services

### Overview

ITO offers consulting services for administrators, particularly valuable for:

- New administrators getting started
- Planning infrastructure changes
- System integration projects
- Evaluating new requirements

### Consultation Topics

### Requesting a Consultation

1. **Email**: support@ito.cit.tum.de
2. **Subject**: Consultation Request - [Topic]
3. **Include**:
   - Your role and chair/office
   - Topic for consultation
   - Preferred timeframe
   - Any specific questions
4. **Schedule**: ITO will arrange a meeting time

## Self-Service Resources

### StrukturDB

The primary self-service tool for administrators:

| Function | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| **User Management** | Create/modify user accounts |
| **Group Management** | Create and manage groups |
| **Host Registration** | Register devices and servers |
| **DNS/DHCP** | Configure network entries |

**Access**: [https://rbgwebapp.in.tum.de/struktur/](https://rbgwebapp.in.tum.de/struktur/)

### Benutzerwiki (User Wiki)

ITO maintains a comprehensive documentation wiki:

- Detailed service documentation
- Step-by-step guides
- Best practices
- FAQs and troubleshooting

### Web Interface for VMs

Administrators can manage virtual machines through:

- Start/stop/restart VMs
- Access remote console
- View resource usage
- Request snapshots

## Emergency Contacts

### Security Incidents

For security-related emergencies:

1. **Immediately contact**: ITO Helpdesk
2. **Document**: What happened and when
3. **Isolate**: If possible, disconnect affected systems
4. **Preserve**: Don't delete logs or evidence

### Service Outages

For critical service outages outside business hours:

- Check ITO status page (if available)
- Email support@ito.cit.tum.de with URGENT in subject
- Leave voicemail at helpdesk number
